I was looking for a fun and interesting team shooter when I stumbled into this game back in May 2016 when they released the open beta for it. This game scratched every itch I felt, it was so INSANELY fun. In my fanatism I ended up pouring nearly a thousand hours on it and convincing all my friends to play it. The first two years of Overwatch were the most fun I've had in a mutiplayer videogame ever. Much like bad times, good times don't last forever.

Blizzard saw a chance at making bank with the newfound competitive scene and began balancing the game around the very top of the competitive ladder (or.. also people complaining in the forums for no reason), making it extremely unenjoyable for everyone else. Overwatch had so much potential and yet, Blizzard chose poorly at almost every chance they got. A lot of really cool ideas and concepts were scrapped and instead turned a blind eye to them just to make more fast $$$. Which is precisely why this game is in Steam now. 

 If you're readin' this and for some reason you haven't played overwatch. Give it a try. But know that the devs will try to empty your wallet and they're very good at not keeping promises. It sucks Blizz cancelled a new Starcraft FPS for this shit..[spoiler] actually let's be honest about it, it was probably for the best to not deface an actually cool IP. [/spoiler] 

Anyway. It's "O.K." but only with friends.
Ramattra is still cool as fuck.

TL;DR: Game sucks i go to sleep.
Achievement generator

First things first, my specs so I can feel justified in my displeasure with this game:
        Alienware M15 R4
        CPU : i7 - 10870H 2.20GHz
        GPU : RTX 3060 Laptop GPU
        Memory : 16 GB
           (it's a laptop, but it runs pretty much every other game I play well.)


              I have put well over 250 hours on Overwatch 2, and it can be really fun, however, I have never had a game run this inconsistent. I can play four hours straight and have zero problems, then suddenly my game can no longer run at anything over 20 fps. I have tried adjusting settings, and even on the lowest settings the game will still run at not much more than 30 fps. Whenever I boot Overwatch, it maxes out my CPU and GPU, despite having modern hardware with up to date drivers.

      Performance issues aside, Overwatch's gameplay loop is fun if you get started right, or are placed in lobbies that are right for your skill level, many times I will open the game just to play two games and those games are the most soul crushing never-even-make-it-to-the-first-objective sort of games. 

      There are 3 core game modes, Push, Point capture, and Payload.

           To me and my friends, Push has been named "Walking Simulator" as a majority of the game mode will have you have a massive team fight at the objective, then you escort the objective. That is fine, what's not great is how when you die in push, and your forward spawn hasn't activated, you can spend minutes just walking to the point, just to get ambushed by a DPS who showed up out of nowhere to send you (zenyatta) to the shadow realm (backspawn) just so you have to spend 9 minutes of actual time traveling from spawn to objective (for the entire match, not at once). The concept of push is fine, however I have seen countless teams just leave matches that they queued 20+ minutes for just because "Oh god, I hate push!" or "I WAITED HALF AN HOUR JUST TO GET PUT INTO A PUSH MATCH?!!" 

     Push : 4/10 it is not great, but I will be okay to play it every once in a while.

         Point capture is exactly what it sounds like, you capture a point. In this game mode, your team tries to capture the point for an amount of time until the capture is 100%, the number will always count up except when it's on 99% and someone from the opposing team is on point. That is all fine, until the point is completely unfair. Take for example that one map on Nepal, Yeah you know the one, whoever gets the point first is most likely winning that round, unless they are severely outmatched by their opponents. 

   Point Capture : 8/10 it's pretty fun unless you get put on an unfair map.

         Payload is pretty good, I don't remember disliking anything about it

    Payload : 10/10 I guess.


      Character balancing in OW is very odd, sometimes they'll introduce an absolutely busted character, such as Kiriko, and then eventually nerf them to make the character a little more easily fightable. Sometimes though a character will be introduced who is not very good, but needs to be played because it's for quests and stuff, but then they get buffed to the sun and back and become insane. 

     Another tangent about balancing is counter play, in Overwatch, there isn't much counter play, there is however, very much counter picking, meaning, you can pick a character, and an opposing player can pick a different character who will do nothing except screw with you and make your experience very not fun.

TL:DR this game is made by a company that just wants your money, and that's why Overwatch 1 was cancelled for Overwatch 2 (: not worth it. can be fun, mostly frustrating.

Даже не знаю с чего начать... покупал эту игру еще на релизе и провел в ней  [u]почти 2k часов[/u] и видел почти все стадии ее падения. 
Помню как разработчики “кормили завтраками” и объясняли еле живой онлайн и отсутствие нового контента тем что они работают над  [u]overwatch 2.[/u]

И вот он вышел и что же мы имеем: 

Вкуснейшая система монетизации в виде батлпаса (который довольно бедно выглядит на фоне аналогов из других игр и не стоит своих денег) накопить на который ftp игроку крайне затруднительно.

Баланс в игре оставляет у меня много вопросов (есть ощущения что разработчики в свою игру не играют и в общем и целом плохо понимают как она работает) 

Обновленный движок это конечно круто когда вы вместо того чтобы выпускать новые карты меняете на них время суток , но хотелось бы чего то большего , обычно если вы обновляете движок то все ассеты тоже было бы неплохо обновить , а тут за мыльные и пиксельные модельки из первого овервоча еще и деньги просят. 

Качество контента тоже упало , сейчас разработчики могут позволить себе выпускать какой нибудь рескин , но забыть его полностью перекрасить и у вас будет персонаж с черной рукой от третьего лица и белой от первого. (скин о котором я говорю был выпущет еще в первом OW к слов) 

Не вижу смысла распинаться и тратить времени на написание отзыва больше чем тратят разрабы на эту игру и скажу вот что : 

Это была моя любимая игра , но это было давно и сейчас  [u]не рекомендую [/u] вам тратить на нее все время , лучшее что она может вам предложить это завести знакомство с какой нибудь мерсимейнершей и детей в процессе , но я думаю с этими задачами можно справится и без overwatch 2 который совсем не оправдывает цифру 2 в своем названии.

I miss overwatch 1


that being said form a casual point of view this game is not nearly as bad as the reviews say, it's (in my oppinion) the best hero shooter on the market, with the most polish, but that's not really a high bar to pass. 
Compared to paladins (which i have played for 600+ hours) its night and day, everything feels smoother and shinier in overwatch and balance isn't nearly as bad. There are still heroes you hate but they don't make up 80% of the roster like in paladins.

Now, I don't know what the new player experience is like, but some of my friends picked the game up recently and the grind for new heroes does seem titdious but again, better than paladins. With that said the hero bundle is the only money you should spend on the the game if you are a new player. DO NOT buy cosmetics in bundles directly from the store it is the worst scam cashgrab i have ever seen, if you really want skins get the battle pass, you level it up extremely quickly.

As for the story missions, I'm not sure yet since I haven't bought the bundle yet. my advice is wait for a discount.

守望先锋是一款多人在线5v5多人在线游戏，他有着优秀的游戏设计，并且运营方面更是优秀，今天早上我买了个入侵dlc终极礼包买了半天还没到游戏里。
我知道这玩意总会到账，可能有人要说我玩这sb辱华游戏硬舔暴雪还买dlc，我只能说你说得对，但是《原神》是由米哈游自主研发的一款全新开放世界冒险游戏。游戏发生在一个被称作「提瓦特」的幻想世界，在这里，被神选中的人将被授予「神之眼」，导引元素之力。你将扮演一位名为「旅行者」的神秘角色，在自由的旅行中邂逅性格各异、能力独特的同伴们，和他们一起击败强敌，找回失散的亲人——同时，逐步发掘「原神」的真相。因为你的素养很差，我现在每天玩原神都能赚150原石，每个月差不多5000原石的收入， 也就是现实生活中每个月5000美元的收入水平，换算过来最少也30000人民币，虽然我只有23岁，但是已经超越了中国绝大多数人(包括你)的水平，这便是原神给我的骄傲的资 本。毫不夸张地说，《原神》是miHoYo迄今为止规模最为宏大，也是最具野心的一部作品。即便在经历了8700个小时的艰苦战斗后，游戏还有许多尚未发现的秘密，错过的武器与装备，以及从未使用过的法术和技能。尽管游戏中的战斗体验和我们之前在烧机系列游戏所见到的没有多大差别，但游戏中各类精心设计的敌人以及Boss战已然将战斗抬高到了一个全新的水平。就和几年前的《 塞尔达传说 》一样，《原神》也是一款能够推动同类游戏向前发展的优秀作品。
确实，除了玩不玩原神以外，上网不玩抽象说明生活过得也相对比较失败，那些人在现实里读书有啥用，画画有啥用，唱歌跳舞有啥用？还不如我复制粘贴“玩游戏不玩原神，就像四大名著不看红楼/梦，说明这个人文学造诣和自我修养不足，他理解不了这种内在的阳春白雪的高雅艺术，他只能看到外表的辞藻堆砌，参不透其中深奥的精神内核，他整个人的层次就卡在这里了，只能度过一个相对失败的人生”有意义，大家来一起跟我转发！不玩原神，失败人生！！！原神就是艺术品！典孝急麻赢！丁真！孙笑川！任何邪恶终将绳之以法！玩了这么多抽象梗，我感觉我人生好像升华了一点点，今天就到这里了，明天再继续玩，原神天下第一！

篮球方面科比·布莱恩特（Kobe Bryant，1978年-2020年），全名科比·宾·布莱恩特，是一位美国职业篮球运动员，他在NBA度过了20年的职业生涯，为洛杉矶湖人队效力。科比被认为是NBA历史上最伟大的球员之一，他的成就和影响力在全球范围内广泛认可。

科比在1996年直接从高中进入了NBA选秀，成为了当时最年轻的NBA球员。他随湖人队获得了5次NBA总冠军（2000年、2001年、2002年、2009年、2010年），并获得了2次总决赛MVP（2009年、2010年）。此外，科比还获得了1次常规赛MVP（2008年）、2次得分王（2006年、2007年），并在2008年北京奥运会上代表美国男篮获得金牌。

科比在场上的球技非常全面，他的得分、助攻、篮板和防守能力都相当出色。他职业生涯总得分达到了33,643分，排名历史第四位。科比也是一位出色的得分手，他在2006年1月22日对阵多伦多猛龙队的比赛中独得81分，创造了NBA历史上第二高的单场得分纪录。

2020年1月26日，科比在加利福尼亚州卡拉巴萨斯的一起直升机坠毁事故中不幸去世，享年41岁。他的离世震惊了全世界，许多篮球迷和业内人士都对他的离世表示深切哀悼。
[h1] Overwatch 1 but shit[/h1]

It's basically Team Fortress 3: a fun hero shooter to have some casual fun with. Most of what you'd expect in a good game is here: great graphics and music, well desined characters, addictive gameplay, excellent maps and game modes.

But then Activision Blizzard decided to destroy the game for some reason: no serious updates for nearly three years, lots of broken promisses, and a new version of the game that is actually a downgrade, with horrible monetization practices; in a few words, "new Blizzard" happened.

It's still worth it, cause it's free. I wouldn't recommend that you spend money on it.

[h1] Overwatch me fez conhecer diversas partes do Brasil, fazendo a minha vida e a de outros mudarem para a melhor - e continuamos mudando.[/h1]

[B]Antes de tudo, peço que ignorem as avaliações negativas; são pessoas confusas, frustradas, trolls, jogadores de LoL ou os quatro juntos, já que não são autoexcludentes.[/B]

Cresci no Amapá, umas das regiões mais remotas do Brasil. Apesar disso, o mundo dos jogos sempre me foi apresentado cedo, afinal, minha família era dona de uma rede de fliperamas quando eles eram febre nos anos 90. A empresa de minha família foi responsável por fabricar cerca de 90% das máquinas que faziam parte do cenário dos bares brasileiros.  Passada a moda dos fliperamas e, vendo os computadores de ascensão, buscamos nos adaptar para as lan houses que também contavam com o aluguel de jogos. Graças a isso, sempre priorizei os jogos de PC. Diversos jogos passaram por minha vida, mas nenhum deles me marcou tanto como Overwatch. Explico o porquê.

Para quem não sabe, o cenário gamer na região Norte do Brasil é extremamente limitado; seja pela (falta de) condição social de cada habitante, como também um desinteresse do pessoal para com esse mundo. Juro para você. O ps2 ainda é o videogame do momento aqui. "E-sports? Diabéisso?".  Comecei a apresentar Overwatch aos meus amigos.

Apresentei Overwatch a alguns amigos de infância meus. Doggo e Raidorck, nordestinos cabra da peste que, nas férias, vinham ao Amapá com a família nas férias. Tenho alguns computadores antigos aqui em casa os quais cedi para que pudessem jogar. E assim começou nossa jornada. Éramos três. E nosso time precisava de um nome: Tapiocas Macapabas -- nada mais justo, jogávamos em Macapá, capital do Amapá e passávamos o dia comendo tapioca enquanto jogávamos.
O Clube Tapioca (Tapioquismo, pros íntimos), não só se tornou um estrondo nacional, mas nos tornamos um dos maiores times da América Latina.

O nosso amor pelo jogo foi tanto que, após muito esforço correndo atrás de patrocínios - obrigada, Lava Jato do Pablo! - co-fundamos o primeiro torneio gamer da região Norte do Brasil: a Curumin Cup, que abrangia jogos como FIFA, R6, como também 100% Orange Juice e CS, para que pessoas com PCs leves pudessem se divertir.
O primeiro torneio nortista de Overwatch cobrava um valor simbólico por equipe inscrita com prêmios todos fornecidos por patrocinadores. O valor de toda taxa de inscrição era revertido para um projeto de montagem de computadores para que mais pessoas tivessem acesso a hardware de qualidade, não só para jogos, como também para o estudo e multimídias que demandavam mais do PC. Aos poucos, a comunidade gamer ia crescendo no Norte brasileiro por parte dos Tapiocas e graças ao Overwatch. 
Nossa família começou a aumentar aos poucos, até o Rio de Janeiro. Preferindo se identificar apenas como "neru", ele era um jogador da base do Fluminense na época e, graças a ele com uma conversinha com a gestão esportiva do time, conseguimos organizar um torneio virtual beneficente entre os Tapiocas Macapabas (apelidados carinhosamente agora de Tapioquistas, já que nosso grupo era muito mais que só o Amapá,) e os Crias de Xerém, como eram conhecidos o time sub-17 do Fluminense.

Esse amistoso gerou uma ENORME notoriedade para o time e facilitou MUITO nossa vida quanto aos patrocínios. Crescemos MUITO e continuamos a crescer. Porque a partir daí conseguimos contato com um pessoal de minas, do RS e SP. Graças às conexões que o Tapioca me proporcionou, pude me mudar e pude me mudar para o Sul, a melhor região do Brasil para viver -- aqui eu não preciso viajar centenas de quilômetros para dar sequência ao tratamento de minhas pernas - tenho movimentação limitada delas e sou cadeirante. Graças ao Overwatch, em breve voltarei a andar normalmente. 
Há quem fale mal do jogo; mas é só você pressioná-los um pouco que basicamente os argumentos se resumem a "hããã blizzard mercenária.....e tal, cobra caro em skin". Ou seja: as críticas geralmente são direcionadas ao aspecto financeiro (e completamente opcional) do jogo, com os "críticos" reclamando do preço de uma skin ser caro demais, mas que provavelmente é o valor que eles já gastaram em uma skin de CS:GO. E acaba aí. Do que mais eles vão reclamar? Da "lacração", por ter personagens LGBTQIAP+ cuja sexualidade nada afeta a jogabilidade?

Com toda a certeza não é por causa dos gráficos: Overwatch é lindo e perfeitamente otimizado. O motor gráfico foi aprimorado na transição do 1 pro 2, dando suporte a ray-tracing. A beleza dos gráficos é tanta que até é utilizado para outras... coisas....

Jogar isso sozinha, no entanto, não é recomendável. A graça de Overwatch está em você jogá-lo com seus amigos. Talvez o pessoal que critique tanto o Overwatch não tenha amigos para jogar com eles. Ou, talvez, simplesmente não tenham amigos. Bam, resolvi a charada!
A verdade é que Overwatch incomoda. Incomoda pelo povo anunciar sua morte desde seu lançamento mas ele ainda continuar vivo e pleno. Incomoda pelo fato de ser um dos shooters mais jogados e conhecidos atualmente. Incomoda, principalmente, a fanbase de TF2 porque eles TEMEM que OW tome seu lugar. E digo que essa rivalidade que os jogadores de TF2 forçam - e que não é recíproca, por parte dos fãs de OW2, diga-se de passagem - é completamente infundada. Nós não enxergamos TF2 como um rival, como um inimigo: enxergamos esse jogo como um modelo, uma parte de nossas vidas, um ancestral, nosso vovôzinho. E ai de quem falar mal de nosso vovô. Sabe por quê? É simples: boa parte dos jogadores de OW2 jogavam TF2 antes e ainda jogam se duvidar. Eu mesma tenho 1500h e digo que foi um jogo marcante para mim. Os próprios desenvolvedore de OW2 olham para TF2 com respeito. Você vê Mighty no. 9 tentando rivalizar com Megaman? Bloodstained tentando rivalizar com Castlevania?
Overwatch busca seguir um novo modelo, respeitando o passado, aproveitando o presente e olhando para o futuro. E é isso que faz o jogo perdurar.

Assim... Se você quiser rivalizar alguém com Overwatch, pegue... pfff.... Valorant ou Paladins... mas a gente sabe que o pessoal só joga esses por falta de opção, né? 
Não nego: o jogo estava meio parado em sua reta final no OW1, mas o OW2 chegou com tudo e continua forte. A nova atualização que está vindo com a Steam, "Invasão", promete ser o update mais massivo em conteúdo até agora. Vai ficar de fora?
Mapas dinâmicos, que mudam seu ciclo temporal entre manhã, tarde e noite. Forte representatividade. 
Overwatch oferece mais de 30 heróis diferentes para você jogar, cada um de acordo com a função de sua preferência e seu estilo de jogo. 
Para nós, o Overwatch é mais que um jogo: ele é uma representação de como nós construímos a nossa equipe. Assim como na Overwatch temos heróis europeus, africanos e/ou latino-americanos, só a pluralidade de nosso time já nos faz sentir tão diversos quanto. Temos gaúchos, nordestinos, amazonenses, macapenhos, paulistanos e cariocas. Quando uma partida ocorre, não são só nossas habilidades que nos fazem obliterar TODO inimigo que enfrentamos: são nossos laços que representam o puro suco de Brasil.

E você, vai ficar de fora?

Not recommended, I played this since the early beta of Overwatch 1 and beta tested Overwatch 2. This was a game promised to "change how we view sequels" through adding PvE missions, branching skill trees, a replayable endgame. What we got was a dozen features shaved off Overwatch 1, a store slapped onto it, Heroes that were previous free locked behind a paywall, and new content in general being locked behind battlepasses and monetization only.

This is not a good free to play game at all. It does not respect your time and you will become incredibly frustrated with it if you try to go without paying. The good heroes are all premium and locked behind battle passes or bundles, and if you try to go into ranked without those heroes you will be flamed and lose a significant amount of times you could have won if you just had the good heroes.

This is a money grab by Blizzard and the developers who created this mess should be ashamed of themselves. They took what was considered a game of the year, and ran it into the ground for pure profit and short term gains.

Öncelikle Blizzard'a hoş geldin diyebilirim. Umarım Diablo ve StarCraft oyunlarını da Steam'de görürüz. Şimdi incelemeye geçelim. Önceden sadece Overwatch (yani Overwatch 1) oynayan biri olarak, ücretsiz olmasına çok sinirlenmiştim. Steam'e gelmesiyle deneyimlemek istedim. Oyunu güzel şekilde cilalayıp dengelemişler, yeni bir oyun gibi hissettiriyor. Değişiklik sanki oyunu ücretsiz yapmışlar da ismini değiştirmişler gibi olmuş, ama sıkıntı değil.

Oyuna hikaye modu gelmiş, demosunu oynadım, güzeldi ve devamını merak ettiğim için yakında edinip deneyebilirim. Oyun genel olarak karakter çeşitliliği ve harita çeşitliliği açısından çok güzel. Hile korumasının da baya iyi olması bu oyuna artı bir özellik katıyor. Arkadaşlarınızla sıkılmadan oynayabileceğiniz gibi tek başınıza da güzel bir deneyim yaşayabilirsiniz. Bunu demek ve kıyaslamak saçma olabilir, ama sonuçta benzer özellikleri var ve birisi Steam'in oyunu olduğu için belirtmem gerekiyor. Team Fortress 2'nin (TF2) gibi bir oyunun var olduğu platforma gelmesi iyi bir adım olmuş, ancak bazı olumsuzlukları da beraberinde getirmiş. Ama şunu söylemeliyim ki bu oyun TF2'den daha iyi.

Eğlenceli olup olmaması kişiye bağlıdır, ancak bu oyunun hem hile korumasının, grafiklerinin hem de dengesinin iyi düzenlendiğini ve korunduğunu söyleyebilirim. Oyun ilk indirime açıldığında Steam'de Türkçe dil seçeneği bulunmaması nedeniyle oyuncuların tepkisini çekti. Doğru mu değil mi tartışılır, ancak bence bu kadar küfür ve olumsuzlukla dile getirilmesi, Türk oyuncu kültürü açısından imajı zedeliyor.

Oyuna biraz daha detaylı bakacak olursak, birçok oyun modu bulunmakta: bölge ele geçirme, bayrak kapmaca gibi birçok farklı mod mevcut. Oyuna başladıktan sonra bir öğretici yapılıyor ve ardından doğrudan oyuna dalabilir veya yapay zeka ile öğrenebilirsiniz. Tavsiyem doğrudan aksiyona girmeniz, çünkü bu şekilde daha hızlı öğrenirsiniz. Seviye atladıkça veya oyun oynadıkça sahip olduğunuz karakter sayısı artar ve daha fazla yetenek deneyimleme şansınız olur. Birçok güzel ve dengeli yeteneklere sahip karakter bulunuyor ve rahat hissetmelisiniz.

Sunucu sorunları veya ekran donmaları gibi herhangi bir sorunu, diğer yorumlarda bahsedildiği kadar şiddetli yaşamadım. Arkadaşlarımın yaşadığı sorunları gördüm, ancak birkaç ayar yaparak çözüldü, bu nedenle abartıldığını söyleyebilirim. Şu an için ara sıra girip eğlenebileceğim bir oyun gibi görünüyor. Hikayesini deneyimledikten sonra fikrim değişebilir, o zaman bu incelemeyi gözden geçirip düzeltebilirim.

tmd本来想蹲一下给个首发差评的，但仔细一想b游戏不值得我熬夜，于是到现在才给。讲道理，这个b游戏带给我的痛苦比快乐多太多了，怎么玩怎么难受，怎么打怎么憋屈。玩t像坐牢，玩c像搬砖，玩奶像上班，主打一个多元化游戏体验。ow2这b毛病实在太多，但又有点闪光点，画风cg剧情之类的，就像哥们吃屎吃着吃着，嘿，还吃着一个虾仁呢！商城骗钱英雄乱改高管摆烂，还有恶心人的elo匹配机制。
高管摆烂就不多说了，国服数据交接，owl二台，“禁止中国选手参加”的翻译问题什么的多了去了，懂的都懂。
然后你这b英雄乱改是真受不了吧。首先是t位，从刚开始的石头剪刀布到现在啥啥都能上也算不错了，就是国服还在的时候说要改猪，改了大半年，中间还说有代码问题一直拖着，现在就改了个b伤害，nmlgb人本来就被安娜克，现在勾过来个安娜一发打不死，还反吃个禁疗加睡让对面打死了。这类英雄特性就是秒杀啊，大体积和没黄甲换压迫感和秒人能力，现在烂完了，别叫拦路猪叫迎宾开门招财进宝五福临门欢迎光临猪似了得了^_^ 
然后是c，为“减少玩家挫败感”，长枪改成啥b样了你自己不知道吗？百合50m开外秒不了人什么意思，我50m跑才跑10秒，你找个b手枪站50m开外冲我脑壳来一发我都直接似。你拿着顶级工匠造的一把超级武器站50米外打一枪头打不死个带牛仔帽的老东西你觉得合适吗？别人那破垃圾枪装个废铁渣子拿漏斗压着打出去都没衰减到你这让你丑完了，吃饭去跟墨菲一桌吧。难怪渗透cg里你打沃斯卡娅打耳环上了，怕打头上就破了个皮死神笑你是吧。改半藏改百合改狂鼠，还有上面的猪，设计师你是家里人走路上让人秒光了是吧这么怕秒人，改到现在就是两边纯扯头发打架，什么运营拉扯都不谈，死了复活继续打就行，你不如改成10个76五五分开放个地图上一方安雷一方防守得了呗。你可以像西格玛一样减石头伤害加核桃伤害增加秒人难度，本来先手或者偷背身，被偷的人就该死没毛病，现在让你改的你把地图里的道和掩体去了我们大平地打得了呗。
还有最逆天的这b和尚，mlgb的，30m挂乱脱离视野2秒没了，你改成和尚以德服人和人把嘴亲上才能挂得了，是你家没个30平你不知道30m多远吗？你这乱除了给t挂还能干嘛？靠乱压奶位和长枪位置基本不可能了，除非你能站你家t前面，2秒没看乱还没了。就算你能给后排挂上乱，还改了飞行速度呢，人看要挂上乱了找个掩体往里面一拉，等乱挂上小一秒没了，再等一会乱没了，你个b和尚能在前排站多久？
再说说皮肤问题，还是贵，金币一个赛季都拿不了多少你一个b皮肤跟这么卖，哪怕也可以银币卖呢？卖贵点呢？不丢人。银币也就通行证获取，你不能每天任务给点？打一把给点？哪怕出点活动游戏里收集呢？你就把你扣烂得了呗。
还有你那b匹配机制，总有人要输，为什么不是我？给你排一个实力不符合段位的或摆烂的是真赢不了。elo主打一个恶心，这把你就不配赢，什么？开麦主动互动努力配合超常发挥吭哧瘪肚打赢了？太棒了，奖励你下把再多来俩逆天的。那句“新手能不能不要玩c/奶/t啊”也是因为这个b机制诞生的。我有个玩破坏球的朋友和算是个新人的人双排，那天下午快速21连输，给我干笑了，是怎么都赢不了，就是赢不了，一打三给队友剩个t和c一回头发现队友被杀光的那种。
最后引用一位我还在打ow的网友的话来总结：我突然发现我和他们玩ow一点激情都没有，就像每天打了10几个小时的螺丝。

This game was so promising in the beggining, back in 2016, but after a total discouragement and lack of proper leadership within the ranks of Blizzard Entertainment, greedy CEOs that turned the game full into microtransactions and paywalls for the original content, I can no longer recommend this game. It sucks badly, not because the in-game things, but the company behind it, the betrayal to the fanbase, the lack of diversity in the competitive ranks and also the deceptive propaganda that Blizzard constantly puts everywhere.-

The entire reason behind OW2 was the PVE content, promised years ago. Now they stripped that away, they put it behind a disgusting paywall and all those who bought the original game feel like this is a very bad dream. I don't have proper words to describe my dissapointment.

I hope someday the game will die properly, and remembered as the "all-time-fiasco" of Blizzard Entertainment.

trash game

TL;DR: A fun, yet hollow game that does not respect it's players and wishes to draw as much cash as possible out of you - it is merely a shadow of what the game used to be.

Overwatch 2 is nothing but a shell of the fantastic game it once was. All game features were, once, provided to a player right off the bat, alongside a forgiving and (mostly) entirely free cosmetic system. Overwatch 2 was introduced as a replacement, or "upgrade" to the original game, and though some arguments can be made that this was the case there also many features which are objective downgrades.

It is upsetting to see a game I was a huge fan of, even back in it's beta in 2016, turn into a shameless front designed to pillage as much money from it's players as possible. Story content, practically all cosmetics, even heroes - compounded around the most parasitic and vile form of monetisation in the industry: the battle pass, which is in of itself packed with filler garbage that is worth next to nothing to the majority of players.

If you wish to play a fun team-based hero shooter: be my guest. Despite the game's flaws and clear inferiority to it's predecessor, Overwatch 2 still contains the gameplay that made it initially stand out many years ago. But do stay aware that the game you are playing is utterly inferior in nearly all ways to it's previous incarnation.

I have spent almost 900 hours on this game since the Overwatch 1 days and I plan to play more. I love the games hero interactions, the fast, dynamic and exciting gameplay that just makes me keep coming back. The heroes and their personalities is something that other games struggle to capture the same charm as this game does. The 5v5 transition was the best thing for the game that makes it far fresher and exciting. Tank is actually fun to play in the 5v5 setting which is something I would never say before the update. The games thematic prowess about heroism in an optimistic future make it stand out from other games in the hero shooter genre. Even though the criticisms of the games story missions pricing, gutting of PvE and microtransations are rightfully criticised. Blizzard sucks donkey and the microtransations are terrible (good skins but overpriced). Neither of those have infringed on the sheer enjoyment this game brings me and many others who love the world and characters. Overwatch 2 is still a game I keep coming back to. From a thematic standpoint its a game that reminds me that even when the world is riddled with awful people that bring it down into darkness. Our world, regardless of how terrible and bleak it may seem, is a future worth fighting for.

It's been clear for years that this game has been slowly dying. The lack of support for OW1 in its lifespan and the esports scene losing a lot of iconic pros has contributed to the state it is in now. Blizzard does not care about the game or its player base, its clear by the monetization scheme and the super over priced skins they are pumping out that offer little to no change at all. I used to be happy every event OW had, now I'm not because I have to pay to get a skin compared to before where I could get it for free by grinding and getting lucky in lootboxes. The balance is horrific and they either go real deep into the right direction, but then they dive heavily into a wrong direction. The game lost its soul a long time ago, and its sad to see the state its in. Please don't support this stingy greedy company.

[h1]I broke my promise to never play Overwatch ever again, just so I can write this review.[/h1]


[b][i]Short:[/i][/b] Don't bother, if you've played the original Overwatch you can call this a scam. If you want the original Overwatch experience, or as close as it can get, play Team Fortress 2. The game that inspired the whole franchise. 

[b][i]Long:[/i][/b] I've played the original Overwatch since day 1. It was fun, but I quickly realized that all the hype around it was, well... overhyped. The game played as advertised, but could get stale after a while due to the same meta. 
Overwatch 2 was meant to be the successor. First being "OW1 but with PVE", offering cross play between the two versions. But eventually they killed the original and forced everyone to go to OW2.

[list]
[*]Balance is badly done. Going from 6 to 5 characters per team caused a lot of power imbalance. The main tank can't take all that damage, so they had to buff the healers, which in turn caused the damage class to deal more damage as the healers were too powerful.
[*]Heroes are now behind a pass. Either you buy it and get to play it immediately, or level up till 50 to unlock it. Missed the deadline? Don't worry you can buy the hero in the store when the new pass rolls out.
[*]Visuals and art is laughable. They claimed that OW2 would be a step up, but all they really did was change the weather and time of day on most maps. Changed the audio of the weapons and the looks of the heroes and called it a day. The artwork for the heroes also feels bland and lifeless compared to the original.
[*]Monitization is extreme. Cheap cosmetics and overpriced crap. The free way is slow and will take months to buy one legendary piece. I haven't touched OW2 and my account is valued at around 2000-2500 euro just from playing the original game alone. I didn't spend any money in the first one.
[*]PVE was the driving force for this game. But they cancelled it and sold the remaining pieces to you for a price. But don't worry, you'd get some high value cosmetics for it in return! What a steal!
[/list]

[h1]This game only exists to get money from you. Lootboxes weren't generating enough money, so they just made an elaborate scheme to get you from one monitization plan to another.[/h1]

[h1]Where to even begin?[/h1]
[b]Positives:[/b] 
-You can leave a negative review on Steam for it and actually voice your criticism, as opposed to BattleNet where that is not an option.

[b]Negatives.[/b]
-Terrible hero balance
-Bland graphics
-Maps made by people who don't understand how to make competitive maps
-Game modes that are functional garbage like Push
-A team game where team communication is through the floor
-Harbors and encourages a toxic community where no one actually has any fun and the competitive mode actively ruined people's outlook on the entire game
-Removed two entire players from the match in a misguided attempt to balance the game
-New heroes are buy or grind only, so much for OW1's claim that all future content updates would be free!
-Cancelled the PvE mode after using it as the justification for deleting OW1 and forcing people to migrate to OW2
-Blizzard, the company, reguarly sees controversy and desperately deflects any attempts at criticism. Read any other negative Steam review for more info
-Overwatch League.
-Blizzard, the company, doesn't respect your time, money, nor YOU. 
-Blizzard is so desperate for new blood for their game they bend the knee to VALVe to allow their games on Steam after keeping their games off other platforms for up to 20 years beforehand.

[h1]Please, PLEASE stay away from this game.[/h1]
This game's great when you don't have someone in your ear telling you it's bad

The tldw version of my manifesto is you're better off playing Paladins or TF2 if you're looking for class based free to play FPS. OW2 is a shallow corporate whore in comparison. 

I've been playing Overwatch on and off since 2016 before the game first launched. I've never been amazing at OW1 but it's been more fun than not. At the very least it seemed like it was in good hands back when Jeff Kaplan was at the helm. In interviews he mentioned how he had to fight the higher ups for things like free updates, heroes, free events, etc. Jeff wasn't some "gamer messiah" but he appeared to be the rare AAA developer who wasn't trying to squeeze as much money as possible out of the game.

Overwatch 2 is terrible in that regard. Going "Free to Play" not only ruined this game but ruined the franchise's reputation. And all the hate Blizzard gets for it is deserved (aside from the harassment of employees but that's obviously not what I mean lol). The executives at Blizzard have pushed the devs into monetising every aspect of the game they can get away with.

- Converting real money into fake currency is a well documented manipulation tactic used by game companies to get you to spend more. They also do the thing where the amount of scam currency they sell you is just under the price of everything forcing you to spend more than you would. Want an item for 2000 coins? Well sorry but the only way to buy coins is in packs of 1400 or 2500 (this is just an example, I don't remember any specific prices). On top of all of that there are exclusive skin packs in the shop that cost over 25$ CAD for a single legendary skin (and technically a spray and voiceline or some shit too but come on). Keep in mind that the brand new fancy Mythic skins which are a rarity higher than legendary can be unlocked from the 15$ battle pass.

- All cosmetics have had their prices multiplied. On top of that they've included a ton of brand new cosmetic items that are completely forgettable and useless just because they needed more garbage to fill out their brand new battle pass. You can also now buy skins directly from the

- Battlepasses. You get to pay for the opportunity to experience FOMO. After all, if you don't complete the battlepass in time then that's a waste of money. So you either need to grind the game like it's your job OR you can pay even more money to skip ahead. If you're going to play a game that much regardless then it's not so bad, especially if the battlepass can give you enough currency for the next one. But game companies are sneaky, they know the majority of the playerbase won't earn enough fake currency to pay for the next battlepass nevermind actually complete the thing.

- There's the PvE aspect that was originally touted as the whole reason why Overwatch added a 2. It was supposed to take the basic PvE missions from the first game and turn them into both a full fledged co-op campaign and PvE missions designed to be infinitely replayable thanks to things like skill trees, changes in objectives and enemies, etc. The latter got cancelled recently however, probably because Blizzard realized they could make more money making skins than actual gameplay content. As for the former? idk giving money to blizzard feels dirty lmao

- This is the most egregious one of all. I could ignore all that other shit if this one thing wasn't a problem:

                                                                     Paying for heroes.

"Other games charge you for new characters (except Dota I hear but I wouldn't know)", "you're selfish/greedy/entitled expecting gameplay for free in a free to play game", "you have to pay for development costs", "it's only [insert USD prices] so actually it's cheaper than buying a full game", "the characters are free if you just wait or play a lot", etc etc. 

The key difference with those other games and OW2 is how Overwatch's gameplay is built around switching heroes mid-match. Being able to swap and counter the opponent in the middle of the round was a core aspect since day 1 and WHY Jeff Kaplan fought so hard for free heroes. Maps, team comps, individual heroes, gamemodes, these are all designed with swapping and counters in mind. Heroes are purposely designed to counter certain strategies while being weak others. If you don't have all the heroes then that's thrown out completely. Imagine playing rock paper scissors except you don't have access to rock, or playing poker but only you can't use hearts. You are left at an innate disadvantage even if the opponent doesn't know it. What's the term where players can pay money to gain advantages over their free to play opponents called again?

It's not about the price itself, though 10-15$ every few months is still a lot more money than the 0$ veteran players are used to. It's more about the principle. You mean to tell me that despite ALLL the other ways Blizzard has monetized the game they STILL wouldn't have enough money to continue releasing heroes for free? Fine, sure. Then what about a compromise? There's currently an option to buy all of the OW2 heroes up to this point for like, 20$ or something. Add another 10 or 20$ on there but extend it to all FUTURE heroes as well. It'd almost be like you're paying for a video game or something idk.

Also no, spending 15-20+ hours grinding the free battlepass/hero challenge doesn't count as the heroes being free. Treating the game like a job while blizzard is advertising their store and skins and currency to you at all times still means you're paying them. It's just not with money. The 5v5 gameplay is fun but not that fun.

In conclusion fuck hanzo.
